TopicTitle: A great JPL talk about Cassini's Saturn discoveries

Articles.Content: Trina Ray (lead scientist of Cassini's Titan flybys) gives a first hand talk about a few of the fantastic findings of the Cassini-Huygens mission. She talks a lot about how people reacted to the data as it unfurled and slowly pieced together some rather amazing big pictures. It's lovely, figured I'd share!

I'll have to watch this later! Cassini was a cool mission. I'm looking forward to when they go back to Titan and hope they send something to Enceladus at some point (maybe a Europa clipper type mission). I know Dragonfly is one in the works for Titan.
